name: Ivanka Trump
religion: Trump was raised a Presbyterian but converted to Judaism in 2008 for her husband.
politicalViews: Trump's family is notoriously and vocally Republican and conservative. She has indicated similar leanings, but has also endorsed Democrats.
author: Tom Kershaw

content.sourceTitle: Donald Trump on Faith: I am a Christian, Sunday Church Person
content.text: Ivanka Trump, daughter and heiress of real estate and T.V. mogul, Donald Trump, was raised a Presbyterian, according to sources indicating that her father is and has been a devout Presbyterian.
Ivanka was born on October 30, 1981 in New York City to Donald and Ivana Trump.

content.sourceTitle: Report: Tycoon Donald Trump's daughter converting to Judaism
content.text: However, Christianity didn't really stick for Ivana. In 2008, after a long courtship with Jewish real estate mogul, Jared Kushner, Trump converted to Judaism so the couple could wed.

content.sourceTitle: Paparazzi catch Ivanka Trump going to synagogue (we're pretty sure)
content.text: Now, the paparazzi consider it a story when they see her going to synagogue,
but she's not too keen to talk much about her faith.

content.sourceTitle: Ivanka Trump on her father, husband and daughter – The View
content.text: Ivanka's father, Donald, is loud and proud about his politics. He's a socially and fiscally conservative Republican and a constant thorn in Obama's side. Donald has proclaimed himself pro-life, anti-gay marriage and very anti-Obama. At times, his stunts–such as demanding Obama's birth certificate to prove he is in fact an American citizen, garner quite a bit of criticism. And Ivanka is asked to either condemn her father or defend him. She defends him.
It's enough to assume she's probably a conservative Republican as well.

content.sourceTitle: Ivanka Trump endorses Romney, praises his 'business intelligence.'
content.text: Luckily we don't have to assume. She endorsed Mitt Romney for president in 2012.

content.sourceTitle: Ivanka Trump switches teams for Cory Booker
content.text: She did throw a party for, and donate $40,000 to, Democratic New Jersey Senate candidate, Cory Booker, in 2013.
So, maybe she switched teams? We'll just have to keep our eyes peeled and let us know in the comments if anything interesting happens.
